title: occasional 'failed to load module error'
body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "TRACEBACK" and input code that you ran to hit this error. I occasionally find that when I run deeplabcut.extract_frames or deeplabcut.label_frames, I get some 'failed to load module' errors. A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Please provide the minimal required code to reproduce the error and the full output (please edit ONLY the section below that says `PLACE YOUR CODE HERE!!! `. **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: [Linux Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS] - DeepLabCut Version : 2.1.10 - DeepLabCut mode : single animal tracking - -iPython **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.: 1. the input code you used - deeplabcut.extract_frames(configPath,mode='automatic',algo='kmeans',crop='GUI') deeplabcut.label_frames(configPath) 4. See error:
TRACEBACK

```python Gtk-Message: 10:06:05.771: Failed to load module "overlay-scrollbar" Gtk-Message: 10:06:05.776: Failed to load module "atk-bridge" Gtk-Message: 10:06:05.783: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module" ```

**Expected behavior** A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. (but please post the code output above, not images of code!) **Additional context** When this happens after executing deeplabcut.extract_frames, this prevents me from exiting the GUI window using the 'crop' button. However, this doesn't happen every time I run this code .. sometimes the errors don't appear and I can continue as usual. A similar issue happens when I run label_frames deeplabcut.label_frames(configPath) Where in addition to the module load errors, I get a long list of repeating critical and warning errors: (ipython:24632): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: 10:07:15.883: g_object_ref: assertion 'G_IS_OBJECT (object)' failed (ipython:24632): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:07:15.883: Error loading theme icon 'image-missing' for stock: Failed to load icon
